data.chText: 荒谬的；荒唐的；怪诞不经的
data.enText: completely ridiculous; not logical and sensible

data.chText: 警卫们穿着那种制服看起来怪模怪样的。
data.enText: That uniform makes the guards look absurd.

data.chText: 那当然不合乎事实，这个想法太荒唐了！
data.enText: Of course it's not true, what an absurd idea.

data.chText: 荒诞的事物；悖理的东西
data.enText: things that are or that seem to be absurd

data.chText: 他对荒诞事物有较强的识别能力。
data.enText: He has a good sense of the absurd.

data.chText: 直到后来她才看出了那种局面的荒唐。
data.enText: It was only later that she could see the absurdity of the situation.

data.chText: 那些画以高得出奇的价格售出。
data.enText: The paintings were sold for absurdly high prices.

ex.chText: 该剧的滑稽场面太夸张了。
ex.enText: The comic scenes in the play were overdone.

ex.chText: 他的笑话给紧张的场面增添了些许轻松的气氛。
ex.enText: His jokes provided some comic relief from the intensity of the scene.

ex.chText: 他是名非常出色的喜剧演员。
ex.enText: He is a great comic actor.

synonyms.bx: 指有趣而引人发笑的；也指与喜剧有关的。

ex.chText: 你穿着你老婆的裤子看起来真好笑。
ex.enText: You look absurd/ridiculous in your wife's trousers.

ex.chText: 认为地球环绕月球运转的观点很可笑。
ex.enText: It's absurd/ridiculous to believe that the earth goes round the moon.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指与常理或正常思维相悖而显得荒谬可笑的，常可与 ridiculous 换用。

ex.chText: 他讲起故事来言谈风趣。
我不明白你为什么觉得这个笑话如此好笑。
ex.enText: I fail to see why you find the joke so amusing.

ex.chText: 这是一部特别有趣的电影。
ex.enText: It is a highly amusing film.

synonyms.bx: 指故事、笑话、电影等有趣而惹人发笑的。

tr: a situation in which life seems irrational and meaningless
example: The absurd is the essential concept and the first truth"--Albert Camu

tr: inconsistent with reason or logic or common sense
example: the absurd predicament of seeming to argue that virtue is highly desirable but intensely unpleasant"- Walter Lippma
the absurd excuse that the dog ate his homework
ask a nonsensical question and get a nonsensical answer
a contribution so small as to be laughable
it is ludicrous to call a cottage a mansion
a preposterous attempt to turn back the pages of history
her conceited assumption of universal interest in her rather dull children was ridiculous

value.def: If you say that something is absurd, you are criticizing it because you think that it is ridiculous or that it does not make sense.

example.ex: It is absurd to be discussing compulsory redundancy policies for teachers...
example.tran: 讨论针对教师的强制裁员政策真是滑稽可笑。

example.ex: I've known clients of mine go to absurd lengths, just to avoid paying me a few pounds...
example.tran: 我知道我的一些客户就为了少付我几英镑，可谓无所不用其极。

posc.def: The absurd is something that is absurd.
posc.tran: 荒诞的事物;悖理的东西

example.ex: Parkinson had a sharp eye for the absurd.
example.tran: 帕金森对于荒诞不经的事一眼即明。

value.tran: 荒谬的；荒唐的；不合理的

example.ex: Prices were still absurdly low, in his opinion...
example.tran: 在他看来，价格依然低得离谱。

example.ex: Absurdly, it makes shoppers overpay farmers to grow too much food.
example.tran: 荒谬的是，这样会使得购物者支付过多的钱让农民去种太多的粮食。

example.ex: I find myself growing increasingly angry at the absurdity of the situation.
example.tran: 对如此荒谬可笑的情况我感到越来越生气。
时下流行的滑稽可笑的育婴法

trans: 荒谬剧场；荒诞派戏剧；荒诞剧场；荒诞派剧场
